intro: Elaeosticta gracilis, commonly known as the slender elaeosticta, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes buckwheats and plantains. The plant is characterized by its delicate, grass-like leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers that appear in late spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Elaeosticta gracilis plays a role in supporting local pollinators and contributes to the ecological diversity of its habitat.
